Author: Fred Stephen Sarfo et al.
Study_pop: individuals (aged ³18 years) who had an ischaemic stroke within the previous 2 months
Polypills: 100 mg of aspirin, 20 mg of simvastatin, 12á5 mg hydrochlorothiazide, 5 mg of ramipril, and 50 mg of atenolol
Median_time_from_MI_Randomization_days: (not sure median, just within the past two months)
Primary_outcome_events: Common CIMT, mm

Author: Ch‡vez Fern‡ndez et al
Study_pop: adult patients of both sexes attending the Coronary Unit from January 2013 to January 2019
Polypills: acetylsalicylic acid 100 mg, simvastatin 40 mg and ramipril 5 or 10 mg
Primary_outcome_events: The effectiveness of the CV polypill which was assessed through the difference between baseline and the last follow-up visit in the mean value of the lipid profile, lipid ratios, blood pressure, and vascular age

Author: Castellano et al.
Country of publications: Spain, Czech Republic, France, Germany, Hungary, Poland, Italy
Study_pop: hx type MI in the last 6 month, 75 y older or 65 with CVD
Polypills: Aspirin (100 mg), ramipril (2.5, 5, or 10 mg), and atorvastatin (20 or 40 mg)
Primary_outcome_events: cardiovascular death, nonfatal type 1 myocardial infarction, nonfatal ischemic stroke, or urgent revascularization

Author: Mostaza el al
Study_pop: men and women aged 18 years or older at high or very high risk of CVD
Polypills: 100 mg of aspirin with either 20 or 40 mg atorvastatin and either 2.5, 5.0, or 10 mg ramipril
Primary_outcome_events: comparison of the mean change in LDL-c and SBP values after 16 weeks of treatment between treatment groups

Author: Merat et al.
Study_pop: individuals over 50 with and without presumed non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (pNASH)
Polypills: 81 mg aspirin, 12.5 mg hydrochlorothiazide, 20 mg atorvastatin, and 40 mg valsartan
Primary_outcome_events: NA

Author: Portela-Romeroa et al.
Study_pop: All patients in the healthcare area of Santiago de Compostela, Spain who, as of December 31, 2019, had an active prescription for the CV-polypill (CNIC-Ferrer) since January 16, 2015
Polypills: CV-polypill
Primary_outcome_events: NA

Author: Yusuf et al.
Study_pop: Men 50 years of age or older and women 55 years of age or older who did not have known cardiovascular disease but who had an elevated INTERHEART Risk Score
Polypills: 40 mg of simvastatin, 100 mg of atenolol, 25 mg of hydrochlorothiazide, and 10 mg of ramipril
Primary_outcome_events: Death from cardiovascular causes, myocardial infarction, stroke, heart failure, resuscitated cardiac arrest, or arterial revascularization

Author: Yusuf et al.
Study_pop: Men 50 years of age or older and women 55 years of age or older who did not have known cardiovascular disease but who had an elevated INTERHEART Risk Score
Polypills: 40 mg of simvastatin, 100 mg of atenolol, 25 mg of hydrochlorothiazide, and 10 mg of ramipril
Primary_outcome_events: Death from cardiovascular causes, myocardial infarction, stroke, heart failure, resuscitated cardiac arrest, or arterial revascularization

Author: Castello et al.
Study_pop: acute ischaemic stroke patients who were prescribed a polypill versus conventional treatment in secondary prevention
Polypills: aspirin 100 mg, atorvastatin 20/40 mg, ramipril 2.5/5/10 mg
Primary_outcome_events: stroke recurrence, reduction in BP, reduction in LDL cholesterol

Author: G—mez-çlvarez et al.
Study_pop: high risk of or with pre-existing CVD participating in the SORS
Polypills: acetylsalicylic acid 100 mg, ramipril 5 or 10 mg, and simvastatin 40 mg
Primary_outcome_events: NA

Author: Gonz‡lez-Juanatey
Study_pop: moderate to severe native valuvlar AS
Polypills: atorvastatin 40 mg/ ramipril 10 mg/aspirin 100 mg
Primary_outcome_events: differences in the adjusted mean 24-hour SBP and LDL-C

Trial name: Polypill for Cardiovascular Disease Prevention in an Underserved Population
Author: Munoz et al.
Study_pop: a systolic blood pressure between 120 and 160 mm Hg, an LDL cholesterol level of less than 190 mg per deciliter (4.90 mmol per liter), an estimated glomerular filtration rate of at least 60 ml per minute per 1.73 m2 of body-surface area, normal potassium levels, hepatic aminotransferase levels of less than three times the upper limit of the normal range, no contraindications to any polypill component, status of not being pregnant, and current use of no more than two antihypertensive medications
Polypills: Atorvastatin 10 mg, Amlodipine 2.5 mg, Losartan 25 mg, Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg
Primary_outcome_events: changes from baseline in systolic blood pressure and low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol level at 12 month

Author: Roshandel et al.
Study_pop: rural participants older than 50 years
Polypills: hydrochlorothiazide 12á5 mg, aspirin 81 mg, atorvastatin 20 mg, and enalapril 5 mg
Primary_outcome_events: major cardiovascular events

Trial name: Post-hoc analysis of the UMPIRE trial
Author: Lafeber et al.
Study_pop: Men and women aged 18 years or older at a high cardiovascular risk (defined as either established cardiovascular disease with a history of coronary heart disease, ischaemic cerebrovascular disease, or peripheral vascular disease or an estimated 5-year cardiovascular risk of ³15%)
Polypills: version 1 (containing aspirin 75 mg, simvastatin 40 mg, lisinopril 10 mg and atenolol 50 mg) or version 2 (containing aspirin 75 mg, simvastatin 40 mg, lisinopril 10 mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg)
Primary_outcome_events: The outcomes of the present analyses were the use of antiplatelet, statin and BP-lowering therapy in the usual care group compared to the polypill-based treatment group and the treatment effect on LDL-cholesterol, systolic BP and estimated cardiovascular RR reduction in relation to the potency of previous therapy.

Author: Selak et al.
Study_pop: M_ori and non-M_ori primary care patients at high risk of cardiovascular disease (either because of a prior event or with an estimated 5-year risk of a first event of at least 15%)
Polypills: aspirin 75_mg, simvastatin 40_mg and lisinopril 10_mg, plus either atenolol 50_mg or hydrochlorothiazide 12.5_mg
Primary_outcome_events: the use of all recommended medications (antiplatelet, statin and two antihypertensives) at 12 months

Author: Lafeber et al.
Country of publications: Australia, Brazil, India, The Netherlands, New Zealand, UK, USA
Study_pop: 378 individuals without an indication for any component of the polypill, but who had an estimated five-year risk for cardiovascular disease ³7.5%
Polypills: containing aspirin 75 mg, simvastatin 20 mg, lisinopril 10 mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg
Primary_outcome_events: effect modification by baseline risk factor levels on change in LDL-cholesterol, systolic BP, calculated cardiovascular relative risk reduction and adverse events

Author: Yusuf et al
Study_pop: 518 individuals with previous vascular disease or diabetes mellitus from 27 centers in India
Polypills: acetylsalicylic acid or aspirin, 100mg; simvastatin, 20mg; atenolol, 50mg; ramipril, 5mg; hydrochlorothiazide, 12.5mg)
Placebo or standard of care: 2 capsules of the polycap plus K+ supplementation
Primary_outcome_events: effects on BP, heart rate (HR), serum lipids, serum and urinary K+, and tolerability

Author: Rogers et al
Country of publications: Australia, Brazil, India, Netherlands, New Zealand, US
Study_pop: adults ($18 years) with a cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk over 5 years of at least 7.5%
Polypills: aspirin 75 mg, lisinopril 10 mg, hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg and simvastatin 20 mg
Primary_outcome_events: systolic blood pressure (SBP), LDL-cholesterol and tolerability (proportion discontinued randomised therapy) at 12 weeks follow-up

Author: Soliman et al
Study_pop: 216 patients without established CVD
Polypills: 75 mg aspirin, 20 mg simvastatin, 10 mg lisinopril and 12.5 mg hydrochlorothiazide
Primary_outcome_events: reduction in systolic blood pressure, total cholesterol and estimated 10-year CVD risk

Author: Patel et al
Study_pop: people with established CVD or an estimated five-year CVD risk of ³15%, with indications for antiplatelet, statin and ³2 blood pressure lowering drugs from Australian general practices
Polypills: Aspirin 75 mg, Simvastatin 40 mg, Lisinopril 10 mg, Atenolol 50 mg or Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg
Primary_outcome_events: self-reported combination treatment use, systolic blood pressure and total cholesterol

Author: Malekzadeh et al
Study_pop: 75 participants, aged 50 to 79 years, without cardiovascular disease who are residents of Kalaleh, Golestan, Iran
Polypills: aspirin 81 mg, enalapril 2.5 mg, atorvastatin 20 mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg
Primary_outcome_events: changes in LDL-cholesterol, systolic and diastolic blood pressure and adverse reactions

Author: Yusuf et al
Study_pop: 2053 individuals without cardiovascular disease, aged 45Ð80 years, and with one risk factor
Polypills: thiazide (12á5 mg), atenolol (50 mg), ramipril (5 mg), simvastatin (20 mg), and aspirin (100 mg)
Primary_outcome_events: LDL for the effect of lipids, blood pressure for antihypertensive drugs, heart rate for the effects of atenolol, urinary 11-dehydrothromboxane B2 for the antiplatelet effects of aspirin, and rates of discontinuation of drugs for safety

Author: Zamorano et al
Study_pop: A total of 1461 patients aged 35Ð79 years with HTN (untreated or treated), TC ² 6.5 mmol/L (untreated), and three or more additional CV risk factors, with or without diabetes but without CHD
Polypills: Atorvastatin 10 or 20 mg, Amlodipine 5 or 10 mg
Primary_outcome_events: calculated 10-year risk of developing CHD at 52 weeks using a Framingham CHD model

Author: Lonn et al.
Study_pop: men 55 years of age or older and women 65 years of age or older who had at least one of the following cardiovascular risk factors: elevated waist-to-hip ratio, history of low concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, current or recent tobacco use, dysglycemia, family history of premature coronary disease, and mild renal dysfunction
Polypills: fixed combination of candesartan (16 mg per day) and hydrochlorothiazide (12.5 mg per day) or placebo and to rosuvastatin (10 mg per day) or placebo.
Primary_outcome_events: The first coprimary outcome was the composite of death from cardiovascular causes, nonfatal myocardial infarction, or nonfatal stroke; the second coprimary outcome additionally included resuscitated cardiac arrest, heart failure, and revascularization.

Author: Lafeber et al.
Study_pop: Seventy-eight patients with established cardiovascular disease
Polypills: aspirin 75 mg, simvastatin 40 mg, lisinopril 10 mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg
Primary_outcome_events: whether there is a difference in morning administration of a cardiovascular polypill, an FDC formulation containing aspirin, simvastatin, lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide, on LDL-cholesterol and mean 24-hour systolic BP levels in individuals at high risk of cardiovascular disease

Author: Lafeber et al.
Study_pop: Seventy-eight patients with established cardiovascular disease
Polypills: aspirin 75 mg, simvastatin 40 mg, lisinopril 10 mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg
Primary_outcome_events: whether there is a difference in evening administration of a cardiovascular polypill, an FDC formulation containing aspirin, simvastatin, lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide, on LDL-cholesterol and mean 24-hour systolic BP levels in individuals at high risk of cardiovascular disease

Author: Grimm et al
Study_pop: hypertensive participants with additional CV risk factors without CVD/diabetes
Polypills: AMlodipine and Atorva
Primary_outcome_events:
the proportion of participants attaining a combined BP goal of <=140/90 mm Hg and an optimal LDL-C level
(<100 mg/dL)

Author: Mariani et al
Study_pop: patients with a previous MI in the last 7 days
Polypills: Aspirin, Atenolol, Ramipril, Simvastatin
Placebo or standard of care: same medications, but in separate pills (not multipill)
Primary_outcome_events: adherence at 6 months

Author: Neutel et al.
Study_pop: Men and women older than 21 years with coexisting HTN and DYS, but without a history of CV disease, who had never received treatment for these conditions or had not received treatment in the 3_months prior to screening
Polypills: combination of a calcium channel blocker (amlodipine besylate) and a statin (atorvastatin calcium) in a single-pill form (5/20_mg)
Primary_outcome_events: the proportion of patients in whom the dual goal of blood pressure (<140/90_mm Hg) and low-density lipoprotein cholesterol control (<100_mg/dL) was met at week 4

Author: Gonzalez- Juantely
Study_pop: adults with a diagnosis of ASCVD, defined as coronary heart disease (acute myocardial infarction, stable/unstable angina), cerebrovascular disease (ischaemic stroke, transient ischaemic attack), or peripheral artery disease (intermittent claudication, ischaemia, amputation), who initiated treatment for secondary prevention between January 1st 2015 and December 31st 2018 (index date)
Polypills: The CNIC-Polypill contains ASA 100 mg, atorvastatin 20/40 mg and ramipril 2.5/5/10 mg
Primary_outcome_events: the accumulated incidence of recurrent MACE during 2 years of follow-up in all cohorts

Author: Castellano et al.
Journal: Journal of the American College of Cardiology
Study_pop: men and women age ³40 years with a history of acute MI within the last 2 years
Polypills: acetylsalicylic acid (ASA) 100 mg, simvastatin 40 mg, and ramipril 2.5, 5, or 10 mg
Placebo or standard of care: same medications, but in separate pills (not polypill)
Primary_outcome_events: adherence to the treatment measured at the final visit

Author: Oh et al.
Study_pop: Korean patients with mild to moderate hypertension and dyslipidemia
Polypills: telmisartan (80 mg) and rosuvastatin calcium (20 mg)
Primary_outcome_events: the change in mean sitting systolic blood pressure (MSSBP) and mean sitting diastolic blood pressure (MSDBP) between the FDC group and the rosuvastatin group, and the percent change in LDL-C between the FDC group and the telmisartan group

Author: Wald et al.
Study_pop: individuals aged 50+ without a history of cardiovascular disease
Polypills: amlodipine 2.5 mg, losartan 25 mg, hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg and simvastatin 40 mg
Primary_outcome_events: mean within-person differences in blood pressure and low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol at the end of each 12 week period
